Package GameModel

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Area
    An Area is an area of the map which is sort of like a room, but not necessarily indoors.
    Armor
    Armor is a subclass of item as well as equipable.
    Bomb
    Bombs are room-dependent items.
    Character
    Character is an abstract class which is used to represent any player or computer controlled characters that can be found within the MUD.
    Consumable
    Superclass for unequippable items whose use methods only effect the player.
    Equipable
    Equipable is an abstract subclass of Item that a Player can equip which will grant bonuses to the Player's combat statistics
    Exit
    Exit is used to represent a way out of an Area.
    GameSimulation
    This class is in charge of managing the mobs in the MUD.
    Item
    Item represents consumables, armor, weapons, and environmental items such as keys and bombs.
    ItemFactory
    Factory class that generates consumables, armor, or weapons, depending on the method called.
    LargeHealthPot
    A large healing potion.
    MediumHealthPot
    A medium healing potion.
    Notification
    Notifications are used to send Note objects to specific Players.
    Player
    Player is a subclass of Character, it is the Character type that is controllable by the user during his time in the Mud Game.
    Point
    Point is a pair of x and y coordinates used to locate an object's location in World's 2d array of Areas.
    SmallHealthPot
    A small healing potion.
    SunWand
    A Sun Wand is used to change the light of a room.
    Weapon
    Weapon is a subclass of Equipable and Item.
    World
    The dungeon in which the game is played.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    This is an enum representing the 4 cardinal directions used for movement in the MUD game.
    EquipSlot
    This enum is used to represent the different locations on a Players body that he can equip items at.
